you installed   sun-java6-jre  and   sun-java6-plugin (on x32?)
I can see that you don't have the sun jre selected, but you might have the jdk selected ....
I will try to reinstall the jre
java -version should tell you what you're running ...
I found the java file, it was in /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun-1.6.0.03/bin/java  is there a way to alias that so I don't have to type that every time?
if you have the   update-alternatives set properly, you end up with /usr/bin/java  pointing at  /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/jre/bin/java
which is a link to the one you speak of
sudo update-alternatives --config java , and press the number on the same line as the sun-java6
